Area.name: Area
Area.description: Areas can be split several times horizontally or vertically to fit different colums or rows

LiteGUI.name: LiteGUI
LiteGUI.description: Core namespace of LiteGUI library, it holds some useful functions

Inspector.name: Inspector
Inspector.description: Inspector allows to create a list of widgets easily

params.name: options
params.description:
object with a set of options { 
	width: total width
	widgets_width: width of every widget (used mostly in horizontal inspectors)
	name_width: width of the name part of widgets
	full: set to true if you want the inspector to use all the parent width and height
	widgets_per_row: number of widgets per row, default is 1 but you can change it if you want to pack several widgets in a row (useful for small widgets like checkboxes)
	one_line: widgets are place one next to the other horizontaly
	onchange: callback to call when something changes
  }

params.name: options
params.description: useful options are { title, width, height, closable, on_close, }

Tabs.name: Tabs
Tabs.description: Widget that contains several tabs and their content

Tree.name: Tree
Tree.description:
To create interactive trees (useful for folders or hierarchies).
Options are:
	+ allow_multiselection: allow to select multiple elements using the shift key
	+ allow_rename: double click to rename items in the tree
	+ allow_drag: drag elements around
	+ height
Item data should be in the next format:
{
   id: unique_identifier,
   content: what to show in the HTML (if omited id will be shown)
	 children: []  array with another object with the same structure
	 className: class
   precontent: HTML inserted before the content
	 visible: boolean, to hide it
	 dataset: dataset for the element
	 onDragData: callback in case the user drags this item somewhere else
}

params.name: values
params.description: (allows object { title: "Nice text", callback: function ... })

params.name: instance
params.description: the instance that you want to inspect, attributes will be collected from this object

params.name: properties
params.description:
an array with all the names of the properties you want to inspect, 
		  if not specified then it calls getProperties, othewise collect them and tries to guess the type

params.name: properties_info_example
params.description: it overwrites the info about properties found in the object (in case the automaticaly guessed type is wrong)

params.name: properties_to_skip
params.description: this properties will be ignored

params.name: instance
params.description:
extract enumerable and public (name do not start with '_' ) properties from an object
 return {Object} object with "name" : value for every property

params.name: instance
params.description: the instance that you want to inspect

params.name: properties_info
params.description: object containing   "property_name" :{ type: value, widget:..., min:..., max:... }  or just "property":"type"

params.name: properties_to_skip
params.description: this properties will be ignored

classitems.description: Tryes to assigns a value to the instance stored in this.instance
classitems.name: assignValue

classitems.description: Used by all widgets to create the container of one widget
classitems.name: createWidget

params.name: name
params.description: the string to show at the left side of the widget, if null this element wont be created and the value part will use the full width

params.name: content
params.description: the string with the html of the elements that conform the interactive part of the widget

params.name: options
params.description:
some generic options that any widget could have:
- width: the width of the widget (if omited it will use the Inspector widgets_width, otherwise 100%
- name_width: the width of the name part of the widget, if not specified it will use Inspector name_width, otherwise css default
- pre_title: string to append to the left side of the name, this is helpful if you want to add icons with behaviour when clicked
- title: string to replace the name, sometimes you want to supply a different name than the one you want to show (this is helpful to retrieve values from an inspector)

classitems.description: Adds a widgete to the inspector, its a way to provide the widget type from a string
classitems.name: add

params.name: type
params.description: string specifying the name of the widget to use (check Inspector.widget_constructors for a complete list)

params.name: name
params.description: the string to show at the left side of the widget, if null this element wont be created and the value part will use the full width

params.name: value
params.description: the value to assign to the widget

params.name: options:
params.description:
some generic options that any widget could have:
- type: overwrites the type
- callback: function to call when the user interacts with the widget and changes the value
[For a bigger list check createWidget and every widget in particular]

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

classitems.description: Creates a title bar in the widgets list to help separate widgets

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

classitems.description: Creates a line
classitems.name: addSeparator

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

classitems.description: Widget to edit strings
classitems.name: addString

params.name: options,
params.description:
here is a list for this widget (check createWidget for a list of generic options):
- focus: true if you want the cursor to be here
- password: true if you want to hide the string 
- immediate: calls the callback once every keystroke
- disabled: shows the widget disabled
- callback: function to call when the widget changes

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

classitems.description: Widget to edit strings, but it adds a button behind (useful to search values somewhere in case the user do not remember the name)
classitems.name: addStringButton

params.name: value
params.description: the string to show

params.name: options,
params.description:
here is a list for this widget (check createWidget for a list of generic options):
- disabled: shows the widget disabled
- button: string to show inside the button, default is "..."
- callback: function to call when the string is edited
- callback_button: function to call when the button is pressed

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

classitems.description: Widget to edit strings with multiline support

params.description:
here is a list for this widget (check createWidget for a list of generic options):
- focus: true if you want the cursor to be here

- immediate: calls the callback once every keystroke
- disabled: shows the widget disabled
- callback: function to call when the widget changes

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

classitems.description: Widget to edit numbers (it adds a dragging mini widget in the right side)
classitems.name: addNumber

params.name: options,
params.description:
here is a list for this widget (check createWidget for a list of generic options):
- disabled: shows the widget disabled
- callback: function to call when the string is edited
- precision: number of digits after the colon
- units: string to show after the number
- min: minimum value accepted
- max: maximum value accepted
- step: increments when draggin the mouse (default is 0.1)

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

- precision: number of digits after the colon
- units: string to show after the number
- min: minimum value accepted
- max: maximum value accepted
- step: increments when draggin the mouse (default is 0.1)

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

classitems.description: Widget to edit two numbers using a rectangular pad where you can drag horizontaly and verticaly a handler
classitems.name: addPad

params.name: options,
params.description:
here is a list for this widget (check createWidget for a list of generic options):
- callback: function to call once the value changes
- disabled: shows the widget disabled
- callback: function to call when the string is edited
- precision: number of digits after the colon
- units: string to show after the number
- min: minimum value accepted
- minx: minimum x value accepted
- miny: minimum y value accepted
- max: maximum value accepted
- maxx: maximum x value accepted
- maxy: maximum y value accepted
- step: increments when draggin the mouse (default is 0.1)
- background: url of image to use as background (it will be streched)

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

params.name: options,

here is a list for this widget (check createWidget for a list of generic options):

classitems.description: Widget to edit a boolean value using a checkbox
classitems.name: addCheckbox

params.name: options,
params.description:
here is a list for this widget (check createWidget for a list of generic options):
- label: text to show, otherwise it shows on/off
- label_on: text to show when on
- label_off: text to show when off
- callback: function to call once the value changes

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

classitems.description: Widget to edit an enumeration using a combobox
classitems.name: addCombo

params.name: options,
params.description:
here is a list for this widget (check createWidget for a list of generic options):
- values: a list with all the possible values, it could be an array, or an object, in case of an object, the key is the string to show, the value is the value to assign
- disabled: true to disable
- callback: function to call once an items is clicked

return.description: the widget in the form of the DOM element that contains it

here is a list for this widget (check createWidget for a list of generic options):

- callback: function to call once an items is clicked

classitems.description: Create a new tab, where id is a unique identifier
classitems.name: addTab

params.name: options
params.description: { title: tab text, callback: called when selected, callback_leave: callback when leaving, content: HTML content, closable: if it can be closed (callback is onclose), tab_width: size of the tab, tab_className: classes for the tab element, id: content id, size: full means all, mode: "vertical" or "horizontal", button: if it is a button tab, not a selectable tab}

params.name: skip_event
params.description: prevent dispatching events

return.description: an object containing { id, tab, content }
